name: Traumatic Hemothorax with Rib Fractures
chief_complaint: I can't breathe properly after a car accident, and my chest hurts really bad.
physical_findings: decreased breath sounds on affected side
treatment: possible surgical intervention if bleeding persists
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, but risk of complications like infection or respiratory failure if delayed
description: A hemothorax is a collection of blood in the pleural cavity, often caused by blunt or penetrating trauma to the chest. This case involves multiple rib fractures leading to bleeding into the thoracic cavity, compromising lung function.
